humanum_full_description_en:
Refers to the premises where soldiers were guarded or tax collection stations were set up at traffic arteries or dangerous crossings. In Qing Xue Fucheng's "Preliminary Discussion on Foreign Funding-Benefits II": "Those who do not receive tax bills should still pay taxes at customs, and they will be charged in case of cards.
62 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: Refers to the place where soldiers were guarded or taxed at the intersection of traffic arteries or dangerous passes.

card
Basic explanation of words
card
qi«é
Checkpoints or tax collection places set up on traffic arteries: checkpoints. Clip.
Tools for holding things: issuing (f?) cards. Tie card.
Sandwiched and blocked: jammed. The fishbone stuck in his throat.
card
k«é
Hold tightly with the mouth of your hand: pinch your neck.
Blocking people: blocking the enemy's retreat.
Special tools for mechanical engineering: calipers. Calipers. Caliper.
card
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªqi«éÔºΩ
["Zihuibu" from Naqie]
(1) In the old days, guards or tax collection stations were set up at the traffic arteries or dangerous crossings.
(2) Dialects. The road is dangerous.
(3) Clamped or clamped, unable to move.
(4) Blocking; restricting, preventing activities and development.
(5) Press tightly with the mouth of the hand.
(6) Specifically refers to keeping people or property and refusing to give.
(7) Apparatus for holding things.
(8) Quantifiers. A circle formed by stretching the thumb and index finger of the hand to measure thickness.
[‚ë°]Ôºªk«éÔºΩ
(1) See "Card 2 Card".
(2) [English card] Abbreviation for card.
(3) [English calorie] short for calorie.
card

card
Source glyph
card
Name meaning
: A place for inspection or tax collection set up in a traffic arteries; suitable for small pieces of paper for writing or printing.
